services.title: Web Development
services.description: Experienced in building responsive, user-friendly websites using a variety of modern JavaScript frameworks.

services.title: Software Development
services.description: Skilled in creating scalable software solutions to solve complex problems, with a strong emphasis on teamwork and collaboration.

services.title: A/B Testing
services.description: Proficient in building front-end experiments using tools like Optimizely and Google Optimize.

projects.name: Conductor
description: Conductor is the SaaS product that I worked on for over 4.5 years beginning in 2020. While I can't go into details about its tech stack, I can say that Conductor is a complex product designed to streamline enterprise-grade transformations, project and portfolio management.

projects.name: Order Up
description: This was originally built for a job application, and relied on an external API. I then polished up this simple order-tracking app and replaced their API with my own, which I built using express.

projects.name: Island Roofing and Siding
description: My father and brother own a small carpentry business in Prince Edward Island, and put together this static site using a great template by Softnio.

projects.name: Widerfunnel (now Conversion)
description: In my previous role at WiderFunnel (now Conversion) I was fortunate enough to get to work on some extremely recognizable brands. Here are some case studies featuring our work with companies like Sport Chek, Envoy and The Motley Fool.

projects.name: joshcoles.com
description: Very meta - you're here right now. This is my own, personal web playground where I can get some experience building in React.js. It's also, conveniently, a place to show off some of my other work.
Like all side projects, this is a work in progress.

projects.name: Vancouver Ipsum
description: This is a very simple ipsum generator that I built while learning Angular 4. Fun and simple to use.

projects.name: Github Battle
description: This was 100% built following Tyler Davies' amazing react fundamentals course at reacttraining.com.
I hosted it at the end of the tutorial and figured I might as well include it.

projects.name: Money on the Board
description: Money on the Board was my final project at Lighthouse Labs. Users could use it to make pledges to charities based on the occurrence of in-game hockey events like goals or hits.
The application was built for a live demo using faked data from a sports statistics API. It lives on in memory only.

projects.name: Cool Parts of the City
description: This was my midterm project at Lighthouse Labs. My team chose to work with the Google Maps API, and we settled on the aptly-named 'Cool Parts of the City'.
Essentially any hypothetical user could create an account and save different maps, each with their own set of markers.
